02 July 2009

VII Annual Local Networks Forum, Istanbul 2009    

Over 320 participants representing 77 Global Compact Local Networks attended this year's VII Annual Local Network Forum, held in Istanbul, Turkey on 9-10 June 2009. The two-day Forum saw a variety of presentations and discussions covering a wide range of issues, from network management to the networks' practices in advancing the Global Compact's core issue areas. Presentation slides and the ALNF report (forthcoming) are available online. (click for website)

Global Compact Local Network Report 2008    

The Global Compact Networks Report 2008 was launched at the VII Annual Local Networks Forum and is now available online. The report reviews network developments in 2008 and demonstrates the ways in which networks serve Global Compact objectives. It takes a close look into Local Network efforts in two areas of particular interest: the Communication on Progress (COP) and civil society engagement.(click for PDF)

GCLN Knowledge Sharing Site    

Access information for the new GCLN Knowledge Sharing Site will be provided to the day-to-day contact person of each GCLN within the next two weeks.

Advance Notice: Campaign on Climate Change - Letter to all UN Global Compact participants.   

The Global Compact Office is a partner in the global advocacy campaigns Seal the Deal! which aims at galvanizing political will and public support for reaching a comprehensive global agreement at the critical UN Climate Change Conference (COP 15) in Copenhagen in December 2009. A letter in English, French, Spanish, and Chinese outlining the campaign will be sent to all Global Compact participants by 7 July. GC Local Networks are encouraged to promote the campaign among their participants. (click for letter)

Consultative Process on Businesses Empowerment and Advancement of Women    

Launched by the UN Global Compact and the UN Development Fund for Women (UNIFEM), this four-month process on the Womenâ€™s Principles is designed to solicit reflections on how business can, in practical and concrete terms, empower and advance women worldwide. We encourage GC Local Networks to solicit reflections from business participants as to how applicable the Principles are to them. We would appreciate if you could share the questionnaire among your business participants. Responses are to be sent to laraine.mills@unifem.org.

Consultation draft: A Guide for Integrating Human Rights into Business Management   

The Guide to Integrating Human Rights into Business Management is an online tool produced jointly by the Business Leaders Initiative on Human Rights (BLIHR), the UN Global Compact and the Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR). The guide offers practical guidance to companies wanting to take a proactive approach to human rights within their business operations and is of use primarily to business leaders and managers in large and medium-sized enterprises, private and state-owned, who would like to develop their understanding of human rights in business practice. The publication is open for an initial consultation period. We encourage Local Networks and their members to review the Guide and provide feedback on it. To submit comments, please fill out the feedback form, or send an email to: globalcompact@un.org

LABOUR

ILO Helpdesk: New service from the International Labou Organization    

The ILO Helpdesk is a new service from the International Labour Organization that provides a one-stop-shop to help company managers and workers understand the application of international labour standards and at the same time help enterprises build good industrial relations. The Helpdesk deals with questions relating to international labour standards and draws on guidance from a wide range of declarations, conclusions, guidelines, tools and instruments. The Helpdesk provides guidance, free of charge, to managers and workers, as well workers' and employers' organizations. Replies are prepared by a multi-disciplinary team, ensuring that users receive a comprehensive response. The Helpdesk aims to provide a reply to all enquiries within two weeks. To submit a question to the Helpdesk, send an email to ASSISTANCE@ILO.ORG. More information about the Helpdesk.
